Value: Dear Jim,On 26/06/07, jim holtman <jholtman@gmail.com> wrote:I think something like this will do it for you.set.seed(1),n <- 10,x <- data.frame(a=sample(1:100,n),b=sample(1:100,n),d=sample(1:100,n)),x$a[c(1,5)] <- NA,x$b[c(7,6,4)] <- NA,x$d[c(5,8)] <- NA,x$total <- rowSums(x, na.rm=TRUE),x$type <- sample(1:3, n, replace=TRUE),by(x, list(x$type), function(z){apply(z[,1:3], 2, calc.prevalence, total=z$total)})
